results.title: The Sleeping tiger
results.brief_description: Directed by Joseph Losey in 1954, “The Sleeping Tiger” was his first feature made in Britain which came to typify what was later referred to as, ‘Losey Baroque’. In this domestic drama, criminal Frank Clements (Dirk Bogarde) becomes a ‘home-trial’ case patient for psychologist, Dr. Clive Esmond (Alexander Knox) and inadvertently his wife, Glenda (Alexis Smith). Forced to undergo psychoanalytic reform in place of a prison sentence, Frank proceeds to provoke emotional conflict in all their relationships. Frank with his excessive passions, and Clive with his emotionally detached approach provide great shadow plays. As Freudian displacement eventuates the themes of disaffection, frustration and alienation spark dramatic changes in all their lives. Dr. Esmond.” In the dark forest of every human personality there is a sleeping tiger.” Who will be freed from their compulsions? Based on the book of the same name by Maurice Moiseiwitsch.

results.title: Point blank
results.creator_credit: John Boorman, Judd Bernard and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based on Donald E. Westlake’s novel “The Hunter”, Lee Marvin stars as an amoral and apathetic antihero in this stylish landmark thriller. Walker (Marvin) is a professional criminal who helps pull off an underworld heist, then is double-crossed, gunned down and left for dead on deserted Alcatraz Island. But he resurface in Los Angeles to track down his share of the loot. Aided by an accomplice (Angie Dickinson), he takes on the syndicate at it’s own deadly game, doggedly stalking his prey across the ever-changing backdrop of seething ‘60s L.A. The trail piles twist upon twist as it leads Walker to a cunning mobman (Carroll O’Connor) and a surprise ending. Remade in 1999 as “Payback” starring Mel Gibson.

results.title: It's my party
results.creator_credit: Randal Kleiser, Harry Knapp and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Nick Stark (Eric Roberts) is a Los Angeles architect who has it all - graced with vitality, good looks, loyal friends, a thriving career, a down-to-earth attitude and an irreverent sense of humor. Although he looks healthy, he has been fighting off AIDS related illnesses for years, and he discovers that he has untreatable brain lesions which will, at best, decimate all his brain faculties within days and he may die within a week. He intends to savour his remaining time by gathering everyone he loves for a two-day farewell party. Nick is a generous host to the diverse crowd he attracts. He draws his guests into a highly charged atmosphere where opinions collide, secrets spill, and old wounds heal as everyone struggles to accept Nick’s fate.

results.title: Hotel colonial (D)
results.creator_credit: Cinzia Th Torrini, Ira Barmak, Legeis Theatrical and Hemdale Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Early one morning, Marco (John Savage), an Italo-American living in America, is awoken by a phone call delivering the news of his brother’s death, Luca, a shady character involved in the Italian mafia and terrorism. Marco heads to Bogota, Columbia, where his brother allegedly committed suicide, in order to identify the body and bring him home. However, all is not what it seems when Marco discovers the body is not his brother’s and the suicide may be a murder. Marco is determined to find his brother, and based on a few clues that point him to a small village in remote Columbia, and knowledge of his brothers’ various aliases and his involvement in drug trafficking, he begins the journey of unravelling the truth. Throughout the search, Marco meets a few characters, becomes acquainted with the locals and learns to appreciate the innocence, natural beauty though indisputable poverty of this small Columbian village. However, upon closer inspection of his environment, Marco also sees the evil, corruption and exploitation that transpire in this small village. It’s only in the depths of this dark and uncivilised land that Marco confronts the true and shocking reality of his brother’s whereabouts, and that he learns its corruption is inseparable from the activities of his own flesh and blood. Despite its cliched plot scenarios and mediocre performances, “Hotel Colonial” shows some genuine concern for the plight of South American peoples though from the perspective of a white American male. Cast also includes Robert Duvall and Rachel Ward. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Beyond therapy
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Steven Haft, Sandcastle 5, Roger Berlind and New World Pictures
results.brief_description: Prudence (Julie Hagerty) is a conservative and slightly mixed-up young woman who thinks Bruce (Jeff Goldblum) is crazy. Bruce is crazy about Prudence, despite the fact that he is bisexual. Their therapists are no better off. Prudence’s therapist (Tom Conti) is more interested in scoring with his female patients than in treating their problems. Bruce’s therapist is as flighty as they come. Throw in Bruce’s jealous lover Bob (Christopher Guest), and his overly protective mother, and the scene is set for madness and mayhem. Adapted from his Broadway play by screenwriter Christopher Durang.

results.title: Rabbit test
results.creator_credit: Joan Rivers, Edgar Rosenberg, Melvin Simon Productions, Laugh or Die and Avco Embassy
results.brief_description: Joan Rivers directs and stars in this acerbic comedy also starring Billy Crystal as a young virgin male, engaged to be married, who finds himself pregnant. His agony and ecstasy of being the first male to bear a child is paraded before an endless gallery of freaks and maniacs - his family and friends (not to mention the media).

results.title: One trick pony
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Michael Tannen, Michael Hausman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Paul Simon used his own knowledge and experience of the rock music industry in writing the script to “One Trick Pony”. He plays Jonah Levin, a one-time successful musician who is approaching middle-age and is increasingly seen as a has-been by the business people who run the industry. His wife (Blair Brown) is frustrated with Jonah’s continual life on the road and wants him to begin to take up the responsibilities that come with marriage and age. Simon wrote the music and songs for this film which forms a musical counterpart to the narrative. As much as it is about music and performance, the film is also an examination of what happened to the ideals and hopes of the hippie generation once it aged. Cast also includes Rip Torn, Joan Hackett and Lou Reed and features cameo appearances by Tiny Tim, soul legends Sam and Dave, the Lovin’ Spoonful and the B-52s.

results.title: Playing for keeps
results.creator_credit: Harvey Weinstein, Bob Weinstein, Alan Brewer, Playing for Keeps and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: On graduating from high school friends Spike, Danny, Silk and Tracy are eager to make their mark on life but are concerned at their lack of suitable job prospects. When Danny discovers he has inherited the Majestic Hotel for the cost of $8000, he takes his friends and makes the move from the city to the country. With town planners on their back with a hidden agenda for a proposed chemical “preprocessing” plant and hostile townsfolk, it becomes a test of stamina to endure the persecution as well as continue the hard work required to renovate the dilapidated motel. Cast includes Daniel Jordano, Matthew Penn, Leon W. Grant, Mary B. Ward and Marisa Tomei.

results.title: City girl
results.brief_description: Anne (Laura Harrington) is a photographer trying to advance her career taking snaps of high profile people in compromising situations. While working on a futuristic fashion shoot, she makes friends with two of the models, Gracie and Sugar, who also happen to dabble in prostitution on the side. Gracie particularly catches Anne’s interest when it is revealed that she has been in a relationship with Champagne Sam, one of the city’s most notorious pimps. Anne soon breaks up with her boyfriend, Joey (Joe Mastroianni), and starts leading the high life, frequenting strip clubs with her friends, and pursuing unsatisfactory relationships with a number of different men. However, Anne’s new-found freedom comes at a price; her latest photographic assignment turns into a nightmare when Champagne Sam, whom she was secretly photographing for an assignment, discovers that she has been hiding Gracie, and ransacks her apartment. Suddenly Anne realises how close she has come to total disaster. But has she realised too late?

results.title: Honky Tonk freeway
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Howard W. Koch, Don Boyd, Universal Pictures and AFD
results.brief_description: When a new freeway is built that bypasses the tiny but thriving Florida town of Ticlaw, depriving it of the livelihood it garners from passing motorists, the mayor and other oddball citizens of the town dream up hair-brained schemes as a lure to the tourist trade. The film follows a group of equally eccentric range of travellers who inadvertently find themselves in Ticlaw—a place they never intended to visit. Cast includes Beau Bridges, Hume Cronyn, Beverly D’Angelo, William Devane, Teri Garr and Geraldine Page.
